title: Stocks end higher on optimism of U.S-China trade deal
text: U.S. stocks finished higher on Friday after progress on a "phase 1" U.S.-China trade deal helped push the S&P 500 temporarily above its all-time closing high of 3,025.86 set on July 26. The S&P 500 SPX, +0.41% gained 0.4% to end near 3,022. The Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, +0.57% advanced 151 points, or 0.6%, to finish near 26,957, based on preliminary numbers. The Nasdaq Composite COMP, +0.70% rose 0.7% to end around 8,243. U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer and Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin have made progress on the first phase of a potential U.S.-China trade detente, and they were close to finalizing some details of the agreement, according to a statement from the U.S. Trade Representative. In corporate earnings news, Intel Corp. INTC, +8.10% rose sharply higher after the chip maker raised its outlook for 2019.
